@wu-sheng 
Through debug, it is found that the problem caused by the `skywalking grpc-plugin`, when the user uses `grpc-client`, the authority of grpc is not set in `NettyChannelBuilder#nameResolverFactory#newNameResolver#getServiceAuthority`, which causes `TracingClientCall#remotePeer` in the `grpc-plugin` of skywalking to be empty. Call `ContextManager.inject(contextCarrier) `in the `start` method; report an error `Exit span doesn't include meaningful peer information`. The user sets the `address` through the `EquivalentAddressGroup` of `grpc-client`, so the `authority` is not necessary. As shown below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11907624/100441475-7bef7e80-30e1-11eb-92a6-79407f4bded5.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11907624/100441485-7e51d880-30e1-11eb-96ea-df8114886761.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11907624/100441490-80b43280-30e1-11eb-9ea2-a764a2f5470d.png)
We need the remote address, could you find where they put in your grpc case?

The tests should be fixed after https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs/pull/1

> P.S. What is the current state of the NodeJS agent, is it considered working? I find it only kind-of sometimes works for me.

It only worked for some scenarios, after https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs/pull/1, it's expected to cover more scenarios, yet I don't suggest to write your own plugin for now, since the docs are not provided and the core codes are not settled down and may change in the following days, I'd like to feed myself the dog food by writing several plugins and make the core codes and docs ready, feel free to provide more negative scenarios that it didn't covered, thanks very much.

Actually the problem in the agent seems to be that it is not dealing properly with the asynchronous nature of Javascript. I am pretty sure I can fix this, just tell me if you want me to push to master or a separate branch?

> Actually the problem in the agent seems to be that it is not dealing properly with the asynchronous nature of Javascript. I am pretty sure I can fix this, just tell me if you want me to push to master or a separate branch?

can you pull the latest codes and work based on that, then open a pull request?
I have set up the tests there, so that you can verify your works easily

I think this feature is good for me. But there are some questions in my mind:

1. Only collect log when having an active span. But we all know the active span depends on the coverage of agents. Maybe we would lose some usage logs when no agent coverage.
2. When we coupling the logs and trace in the segment, maybe this way would add more memory cost. For example, in our department, the maximum throughput is about 1000 ops in a pod, and the average size of each log is about 7.5KB. I am not sure about the final cost when using the feature in production.
3. Extract metrics for Log to observe or monitor is a common way of production. This kind of sending adds complexity.

For Prometheus, yes, TSDB makes sense. But honestly, I am not sure whether TSDB is the best option for SkyWalking.

> srelay maintenance is a important issue

This would be a big issue, we can't accept to make all things configurable but just for a lack of maintenance project.
not only srelay use JSON format as response format.native influxdb also support JSON format.

elasticsearch is not a reasonable solution for skywalking.agent may push many metrics,each metric has a indics with timestamp 'yyyy-mm-dd'.so many indics and shards that elasticsearch can not manage.on the other hand,the reasonable size of shards in es is 20G-50G. and skywalking storage size is difficult to estimate.how to set configuration of elasticsearch index?
skywalking used many time series data.obviously this data is not suitable for storage in a realtional database like pgsql,h2.
